meanings.sent1: She skidooed from the party when it started raining.
meanings.sent2: He skidooed out of the room before anyone could ask him questions.
meanings.sent3: The cat skidooed away when it saw the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The idea of exercise made him skidooed from the gym like a startled deer.
meanings.sent5: The children skidooed from the playground when the ice cream truck arrived.

meanings.sent1: The magician skidooed from the stage in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent2: The ghost skidooed through the wall, leaving everyone in shock.
meanings.sent3: The cookies skidooed from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her worries skidooed from her mind as she focused on the present moment.
meanings.sent5: The sun skidooed behind the clouds, casting a shadow over the field.

meanings.definition: To go away or run off.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel skidooed up the tree when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The thief skidooed down the alley, disappearing into the night.
meanings.sent3: The ball skidooed across the field, evading the players.
meanings.sent4: His dreams skidooed into the distance, leaving him feeling lost.
meanings.sent5: The car skidooed around the corner, leaving a trail of dust behind.
